text:
Copy sent to Leonard Marks 5/16/61
CHANNEL
STUDIOS—UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON
w
TRANSMITTER—EDISON TECHNICAL SCHOOL
KCTS-TV
SEATTLE 5, WASHINGTON
May 10, 1961
Bill Harley
NAEB
Washington, D. C.
Dear Bill:
Dr. Charles E. Odegaard, president of our University,
sent along for my information, a letter he recently
received fro Ken Cox, now head of the Broadcast
Bureau at the FCC. Dr. Odegaard had written Ken
conplementing him on having taken on the job.
Included in Ken's reply was this statement" — I think
there is some possibility that we may attempt to
establish liaison with academic people in the Communi¬
cations fiffe&d in an effort to see whether or not they
can furnish the Commission with research materials of
value in connection with our work."
If and when you have the opportunity to establish a
contact with Ken, you might like to inquire if there
are ways NAEB can bring to play the academic talents
available to it, in helping the Commission with its
work.
University of Washington . Seattle Public Schools .King County Schools • Seattle University * Seattle Pacific College £ Seattle Public Library
